content: One of the things we talked about this week was http://build.fhir.org/credits.html – we update it towards the end of publishing our milestone releases. There’s so many (100s) of individuals and organizations that we need to add to it… it's out of control
any thoughts as to what we should do with it?
I think it's important: as you know - and I often say - our real treasure is the FHIR community...

I used to drive some of the reporting based on commit volume, but SVN gave up the ghost on being able to report that a while ago - and it's complicated by our switch to SVN. I can run a report that identifies primary raisers of tracker issues. I also used to add the organizations that had signed up for connectathons - but that too is getting to be extreme.
We can use commit history in GitHub going back to 2013, too.
I’ll note that committer is a subset of contributors. Many people contribute who don’t have committer rights. Not that that makes your cleanup any easier.
